author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Parliamentary Budget Office (PBO) says five federal departments have released plans to cut nearly 2,000 jobs by 2030, representing workforce reductions of 4.7 percent. “Information on service-level impacts was limited and varied across organizations, but all indicated that the planned reductions are expected to have a ‘low’ or ‘limited’ impact on existing service levels,” […]
title: Federal Departments Plan Job Cuts of 5 Percent, Lower Than Carney’s 10 Percent Promise: Budget Watchdog

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says she met with Prime Minister Mark Carney on Jan. 9 to urge him to expedite approvals for construction of an oil pipeline from Alberta to the B.C. coast in light of the events in Venezuela. Smith said that Alberta will now submit a pipeline proposal to Ottawa’s Major Projects Office […]
title: Alberta Premier Smith Asks Carney for Quick Pipeline Approval Amid Venezuela Events

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Election Campaign in Uganda, Missile Attacks in Ukraine, and Political Prisoners Released in Venezuela

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Conservative Party will be debating policy proposals around issues dealing with the economy and the resource sector, as well as cultural issues including abortion, and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives at its upcoming convention. Delegates from across Canada will meet in Calgary from Jan. 29 to 31 at the first convention since the […]
title: Conservatives to Debate Immigration, Abortion, Pipelines at Upcoming Convention

author: Alex Wu
description: The survey also showed that employment contracted for the fifth consecutive month in December.
title: China’s Services PMI Growth Hits 6-Month Low in December: S&P Global Survey

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Former Calgary mayor Naheed Nenshi says he wasn’t informed that Calgary’s largest feeder main, which ruptured for a second consecutive year last week, had been flagged as high risk of failure while he was in office. The Bearspaw South Feeder Main, which carries about 60 percent of Calgary’s potable water, was recommended for inspection in […]
title: Former Calgary Mayor Nenshi Says He Wasn’t Told Water Main Was Flagged as High Risk While in Office

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Coalition Avenir Québec member of the legislature arrested this week for alleged impaired driving is withdrawing from caucus for the duration of the legal proceedings against him. François Tremblay has represented the riding of Dubuc, Que., in the Saguenay-Lac-Saint-Jean region, since 2018. The chief government whip, François Jacques, announced Tremblay’s withdrawal in a short […]
title: Coalition Avenir Québec Member Withdraws From Caucus After Impaired Driving Arrest

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is joining European leaders in condemning Russia’s use of a powerful hypersonic missile on Ukraine as an escalation. Carney says Russia’s second use of the Oreshnik missile is “a clear and dangerous escalation that targeted Ukrainian energy infrastructure and the homes of innocent Ukrainians.” Moscow says the weapon can evade missile […]
title: Canada Condemns Russia’s Use of Hypersonic Missile as Escalation in Ukraine War

author: Emel Akan
description: Giant oil companies will be spending at least $100 billion to 'rebuild the capacity and the infrastructure necessary' in Venezuela, the president said.
title: Trump Says Oil Companies Will Spend $100 Billion in Venezuela

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Pele Broberg, leader of Greenlandic opposition party Naleraq, strongly favors independence for the Danish territory, which could involve a deal with Washington.
title: Greenland Should Talk to US Without Denmark, Opposition Leader Says

author: Chandra Philip
description: A viral video of WestJet’s new economy-style seating has some passengers concerned about comfort and safety, while the company says the changes are “in line” with other North American airlines. WestJet announced last September plans to upgrade its aircraft by replacing its traditional economy class reclining seats with fixed-back designs. The company said at the […]
title: WestJet Says Its Monitoring Feedback After Passenger Video of New Economy Seats Goes Viral

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Provincial Court of B.C. has vacated two fines issued against a pastor who took part in worship services in contravention of COVID-19 lockdown rules. Justice Andrea Ormiston amended the court’s record on Jan. 8 after the Crown acknowledged the two penalties imposed on pastor John Koopman of the Free Reformed Church in Chilliwack, B.C., […]
title: BC Court Nullifies 2 Fines Against Pastor for Attending Church During Pandemic Restrictions

author: Guy Birchall
description: Protesters have been urged on by Reza Pahlavi, the exiled son of the shah who was toppled in the 1979 Islamic Revolution.
title: Iran Signals Upcoming Crackdown on Protestors as Demonstrations Continue

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Chinese Canadian pro-democracy activist Sheng Xue says the timing of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s visit to China next week “sends a deeply troubling signal,” given the United States, Canada’s closest ally, is taking action to curb the regime’s reach in the Western Hemisphere. Carney will meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, Premier Li Qiang, and […]
title: Carney’s Beijing Visit Sends a ‘Deeply Troubling Signal’: China Watchers Alarmed by PM’s Trip

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Conservatives are calling on the Canadian Food Inspection Agency to pause the implementation of new livestock tracking regulations, citing concerns about regulatory burden on farmers. The CFIA first published proposed amendments to Canada’s “Health of Animals Regulations” in 2023, to expand livestock tracking requirements and introduce mandatory movement reporting for several additional species of […]
title: Tories Call on CFIA to Abandon Proposed Changes to Livestock Tracking Regulations

author: Chandra Philip
description: Nearly 25 years after they stepped up to help stranded airline passengers during 9/11, residents in Gander, N.L., displayed their generosity again by forming a volunteer shuttle service for hundreds of travellers whose flights were diverted to the small community. Gander resident Jackie Freake, who is the assistant manager of the Quality Inn in Gander, […]
title: ‘They All Have Big Hearts’: NL Community Celebrated for Helping Stranded Airline Passengers on 9/11 Does It Again

author: Michael Zhuang
description: Preliminary data show nearly 179,000 Chinese nationals sought asylum worldwide in 2025, with the United States receiving the vast majority of claims.
title: Chinese Asylum Claims Near Record Levels in 2025, UN Data Show

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Ahmed al-Sharaa also spoke to French President Emmanuel Macron via telephone to discuss bilateral cooperation and updates within the region.
title: EU Leaders Meet With Syrian President to Pledge Recovery Support After Years of Civil War

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Government spending in B.C. has reached its highest level on record after adjusting for inflation, totalling $13,711 per person in 2025, according to a new study. The study, released on Jan. 6 by the Fraser Institute, examined British Columbia’s per-person government spending by premiers from 1965 to 2025. It found that the highest spending level […]
title: BC Government Per-Person Spending Highest on Record, Inflation-Adjusted: Study

author: The Canadian Press
description: A company that operated a chemical manufacturing plant in western Quebec has been fined $1.35 million for discharging a harmful substance into the Rivière du Lièvre in 2019. Superior General Partner Inc., which owned and operated the Erco Mondial plant in 2019, had pleaded guilty in Quebec court to 12 counts of discharging sodium chlorite […]
title: Quebec Chemical Firm Hit With $1.4-Million Fine Over Substance Discharged in River

author: Andrew Moran
description: Support for Argentina's Javier Milei was an 'America First homerun deal,' says Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.
title: Argentina Repays $20 Billion US Swap Line, Bessent Says

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Trump said the Venezuela operation reflected a unique security threat and should not be read as a green light for Chinese action on Taiwan.
title: Trump Says US Action in Venezuela Does Not Set Precedent for China to Move on Taiwan

author: Guy Birchall
description: A total of 40 people died in the New Year's Day blaze at Le Constellation in the ski resort of Crans-Montana.
title: Switzerland Holds Day of National Mourning for Alpine Bar Fire Victims

author: Jack Phillips
description: The tanker, Olina, was suspected of being part of a 'ghost fleet' meant to evade U.S. sanctions.
title: US Military Seizes Another Tanker in Caribbean Sea ‘Without Incident’

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The government of Canada has slated 2026 as a census year and is planning to recruit more than 30,000 personnel to conduct the population count that occurs twice each decade. The census is a national tally by Statistics Canada of the country’s population and housing. It is carried out every five years to furnish essential […]
title: Statistics Canada Hiring 32,000 Workers for Nationwide Census

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Trump also said that at least $100 billion would be invested by major oil companies in Venezuela’s energy sector.
title: Trump Cancels Second Wave of Attacks Against Venezuela After Prisoner Release

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: James Passafiume always knew he wanted to pursue a career in construction, but after high school he was confronted with the dilemma of choosing between an office management position or a more hands-on role at the worksite. He chose the latter option, attending Humber Polytechnic’s Building Construction Technician program in Toronto, where he learned the […]
title: Hands-On Wins: Why This Recent Grad Bet on Trades Over Office Life

author: Guy Birchall
description: Reza Pahlavi, the son of the shah deposed in 1979, called on Iranians to take to the streets in a post on X.
title: Internet, Phones Cut in Iran as Protesters Answer Exiled Prince’s Call for Protests

description: A few writers complained the move equated to censorship.
title: Nearly 50 Authors Withdraw From Writers’ Festival After Staunch Israel Critic Dropped

description: The cartoon by artist Cathy Wilcox, was published in print and online on Jan. 7 in the publication owned by Nine Newspapers.

description: ‘Fight with all their might for the motherland.’ Chinese students are pressured into advancing Beijing’s interests in America.
title: Behind the Group That Controls Chinese Students in America

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: This surge has likely come at the expense of the Liberal-National Coalition, which recorded an 8.8 percent swing away from it, while Labor saw a 5.9 dive.
title: New Poll Reveals Support for One Nation Now Level With Liberal Party

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: One Nation has surged to match Coalition support in a new national poll, with modelling suggesting a hypothetical contest with Labor could be evenly split.
title: Polling Shows One Nation Gaining Ground Rapidly

description: Australian children's author Matt Chun has been a consistent critic of 'Zionists.'
title: Police Investigate Children’s Author After Posts Condemning Grief for Bondi Victims

description: Among those released are two prominent Venezuelan opposition figures, according to local rights groups.
title: Venezuela Frees Political Prisoners in Bid to ‘Seek Peace’

author: Joseph Lord
description: 'We knocked out ... the drugs coming in by water, and we are going to start now hitting land with regard with the cartels,' the U.S. president said.
title: Trump Says US Will Begin Land Strikes on Cartels in Mexico

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Repeatedly accessing violent sexual imagery had desensitised him to the potential harms, a New Zealand coroner has said.
title: Accidental Death of Teen Linked to Porn Addiction Prompts Call for Internet Restrictions

description: Police said the brawl was associated with a dispute in the same community two days earlier, which involved as many as 100 people.

description: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed was presented with an award by an emotional Bill Ackman and received a medal from the NYPD.

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford is calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney to keep 100 percent tariffs on Chinese electric vehicle (EVs) in place, ahead of Carney’s upcoming trip to Beijing. Canada is reviewing its decision to put 100 percent tariffs on Chinese-manufactured EVs in October 2024, in addition to a 25 percent surtax on imports […]
title: Ontario Premier Ford Urges Carney to Keep 100 Percent Tariffs on Chinese EVs

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative MP Dean Allison says Prime Minister Mark Carney’s upcoming trip to China rewards a regime that is interfering in Canada’s affairs and committing human rights abuses. “Mark Carney is heading to China next week to ‘expand relations’ with a regime that: • commits massive human rights abuses • engages in industrial espionage • steals […]
title: Carney’s China Trip Rewards a Regime Engaged in ‘Massive Human Rights Abuses’, Interference: Tory MP

author: Marcos Schotgues
description: The U.S. military operation is likely to have a ripple effect throughout the region, including at the ballot box, they say.
title: Maduro’s Downfall a Setback for US Adversaries, Experts Say

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney will meet with the leader of Qatar after his upcoming trip to China and before his attendance at the World Economic Forum’s (WEF) annual meeting in Switzerland. Carney is scheduled to meet with Chinese regime leader Xi Jinping Jan. 13 to 17 in Beijing, followed by a Jan. 18 visit to […]
title: Carney Adds Qatar Stop to Beijing, Davos Trip
